item.title: Report X-2023081146
item.description:
Report X-2023081146

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-12
  • City: NORFOLK
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came in with bottom closures open and an admin taped up the bottom and opened the top closures to replace the bottles inside. They were using the foam liner to lift the bottles while supporting the bottom when the foam liner failed and two of the 4L bottles fell out. They fell to the floor and shattered and released their contents. The spill and broken glass was cleaned up and placed in a HazMat tote. DescribePack: Package came with bottom closures open. Foam liner failed and glass bottles fell to the floor and shattered. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Spill was cleaned up immediately with loose absorb.

item.title: Report E-2023090172
item.description:
Report E-2023090172

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: AURORA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 5 gallon bladder filled box of 184 stripper (un1760) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 2 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023090088
item.description:
Report E-2023090088

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: HASTINGS
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 29, 2023, at 1239 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Hastings, Nebraska regarding the release of approximately (0.5) gallons of PT-130 (Ferric Sulfate 60%) Corrosive Liquid, Acidic, Inorganic, N.O.S. (UN3264, 8, III) from (1) IBC Tote. The release was reportedly due to a loose nozzle and contained to the trailer floor. Contractors cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55- gallon poly drum and taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.
